questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that contains 70 remote users.
The remote users work from various locations.
Recently, each remote user purchased a personal computer that runs Windows 10 Home.
You need to configure the VPN settings on the computers automatically by using the least amount of administrative effort.
What should you use?

comments.content:
It is not Autopilot.

The following editions are supported:
Windows 10 Pro
Windows 10 Pro Education
Windows 10 Pro for Workstations
Windows 10 Enterprise
Windows 10 Education

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/software-requirements#software-requirements

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. a provisioning package.

deployments that range from tens to a few hundred computers

let you quickly and efficiently configure a device without having to install a new image

It can result in a significant reduction in the time required to configure multiple devices

configuring multiple devices using one provisioning package.

Quickly configure employee-owned devices

attached to an email

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/configuration/provisioning-packages/provisioning-packages
Since they all are personal computer, I'd recommend giving everybody a Provisioning Package.

comments.content: Forgot to add, also because the laptops are newly purchased.
Group Policy Object (GPO) won't work on just bought Windows Home computers. A Provisioning Package can be send to all of them via email.

discussion.content: Answer should be B: https://windowsreport.com/vpn-group-policy/

choices.C: Install the last quality update, and then install the last feature update.
choices.B: Install the last quality update, and then install both feature updates.
choices.A: Install the last feature update, and then install the last quality update.
choices.E: Install all the quality and feature updates in the order in which they were released.
choices.D: Install the last feature update, and then install all the quality updates released after the feature update.

discussion.content:
A is correct.
Feature updates: Released as soon as they become available. Feature updates add new features and functionality to Windows 10. Because they are delivered frequently (rather than every 3-5 years), they are easier to manage.
Quality updates: Quality updates deliver both security and non-security fixes. Quality updates include security updates, critical updates, servicing stack updates, and driver updates. They are typically released on the second Tuesday of each month, though they can be released at any time. The second-Tuesday releases are the ones that focus on security updates. Quality updates are cumulative, so installing the latest quality update is sufficient to get all the available fixes for a specific feature update, including any out-of-band security fixes and any servicing stack updates that might have been released previously.

C. Install the last quality update, and then install the last feature update.
It's recommended to first install the latest quality update and then install the latest feature update to ensure that your computer runs the latest version of Windows 10 and is fully updated. This method minimizes the amount of time required to update the computer and helps to ensure that any security or bug fixes in the quality update are included in the update process.

Selected Answer: A
A seems correct.

Ambos possuem a ideia de “all previous cumulative updates”, veja:

Windows 10, version 22H2 is a feature update for Windows 10. It's a scoped release focused on quality improvements to the overall Windows experience in existing feature areas. It includes all previous cumulative updates to Windows 10, version 21H2. This article is for IT professionals, it lists information about this release that you should know.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/whats-new/whats-new-windows-10-version-22h2

A Windows feature update is an update that contains new features. A feature update also includes all previous quality updates, as applicable.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/faq/windows#what-is-the-difference-between-a-windows-quality-update-and-a-windows-feature-update-

D. Install the last feature update, and then install all the quality updates released after the feature update.

comments.content: A is correct and from the link provided ..."Quality updates are cumulative, so installing the latest quality update is sufficient to get all the available fixes for a specific feature update"...

questions.question_text:
You have a computer named Computer1 that runs Windows 10.
Computer1 was off for one year. During that time, two feature updates and 12 quality updates were released.
From the Microsoft Update Catalog website, you download the missing updates and save the updates to Computer1.
You need to ensure that Computer1 runs the latest version of Windows 10 and is fully updated. The solution must minimize the amount of time required to update the computer.
What should you do?

HOTSPOT -
You have the computers shown in the following table.
//IMG//

You apply the 20H2 feature update as soon as the update is available.
How many months of servicing does each computer support without installing another feature update? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
It's 30, 18, 30 because Computer 3 is Windows 10 Enterprice
https://docs.microsoft.com/it-it/lifecycle/products/windows-10-enterprise-and-education

comments.content:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-10-home-and-pro
Indeed. It would not even make sense if Windows 10 Education would have longer support than Enterprise as they're about on the same level in terms of advanced benefits and functionality.

Agreed, MS keeps changing it, So this is current, its 30-18-30
Also, we don't know if its the march one or the sept one.... So its a BS question. Assume the max.

Given the old time of the question, and responding to the statement "without installing another feature update?"

30, 18, 30.

The actual exam, I don't know, but something new about servicing channel could come up related to general availability channel and not semi-annual channel anymore.

Feature updates now releases annually beginning from version 21H2 (11/16/21).

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/whats-new/whats-new-windows-10-version-21h2
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-10-enterprise-and-education
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-10-home-and-pro

30 - 18 - 30 
Ref > https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/waas-overview

Perguntas frequentes sobre o Ciclo de Vida – Windows

Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Education, Windows 10 IoT Enterprise: 30 meses a partir da data de lançamento
Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Pro Education, Windows 10 Pro for Workstations, Windows 10 Home2: 18 meses a partir da data de lançamento

https://docs.microsoft.com/pt-br/lifecycle/faq/windows

Correct Solution: 30-18-30

Explanation: 
Enterprise & Education - Win10 -> 30 months
Pro - Win10 -> 18 months

Source: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/faq/windows

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/announcements/windows-10-servicing-support-updates
The answer will be 30 , 18, 18

comments.content: OLD link (2018) the correct solution is 30,18,30

discussion.content: Basically, remove the computer from the domain then rejoin it to the domain, right?

comments.content: if you delete computer in AD change the SID you need only to reset the computer
don't forget to delete old record in your AD...

discussion.content: First check your connectivity with the domain. Then use in an elevated admin prompt and use nltest/exe /sc_verify and/or /sc_verify and or /sc_reset When that not works, the re-join domain option would be my next step

Little trick you can do to solve Trust issues

On PowerShell

test-computersecurechannel -repair

The troubleshooting process from quickest to longest solution should be the following:
1) Run the gpupdate command on an elevated prompt to attempt trust relationship restoration
2) If the above command reports "failed because of lack of network connectivity to a domain controller" error, check ethernet settings (DNS must include a record for the domain controller's IP)
3) Remove the computer from the domain and re-join as shown in the solution

In my Lab for this question the issue was that the DNS was missing from network settings (All the network settings are static). DC has also DNS role so by filling to DNS settings the DC1 IP it solves the problem.

The link provided is for Win 7. To do this on Win 10 just click Start, type sysdm.cpl and hit Enter to open the Advanced system settings. Click the Computer Name tab and perform the task. Tested myself.
I actually just did this in my exam, but after rebooting the domain couldn't be found anymore.. So couldn't finish this question, anyone got an idea what went wrong?

1. change domain to workgroup (no reboot)
2. change workgroup to domain (no reboot)
trust relation repaired

When the Next button is available, click it to access the lab section. In this section, you will perform a set of tasks in a live environment. While most functionality will be available to you as it would be in a live environment, some functionality (e.g., copy and paste, ability to navigate to external websites) will not be possible by design.
Scoring is based on the outcome of performing the tasks stated in the lab. In other words, it doesn't matter how you accomplish the task, if you successfully perform it, you will earn credit for that task.
Labs are not timed separately, and this exam may more than one lab that you must complete. You can use as much time as you would like to complete each lab.
But, you should manage your time appropriately to ensure that you are able to complete the lab(s) and all other sections of the exam in the time provided.

Users who attempt to sign in to the domain from Client3 report that the sign-ins fail.
You need to resolve the issue.
To complete this task, sign in to the required computer or computers.
questions.answer_description:
1. Use a local administrator account to log on to the computer.
2. Select Start, press and hold (or right-click) Computer > Properties.
3. Select Change settings next to the computer name.
4. On the Computer Name tab, select Change.
5. Under the Member of heading, select Workgroup, type a workgroup name, and then select OK.
6. When you are prompted to restart the computer, select OK.
7. On the Computer Name tab, select Change again.
8. Under the Member of heading, select Domain, and then type the domain name.
9. Select OK, and then type the credentials of the user who has permissions in the domain.
10.When you are prompted to restart the computer, select OK.
11.Restart the computer.
Reference:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2771040/the-trust-relationship-between-this-workstation-and-the-primary-domain

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains 1,000 computers that run Windows 10.
You discover a known compatibility issue between a feature update and a device driver on the computers.
You need to test the installation of the feature update on a test computer.
Which Windows Update setting should you configure by using a Group Policy Object (GPO)?

choices.C: Select the target Feature Update version
